intro: Carex aterrima subsp. aterrima, commonly known as black sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, grasses, and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black, stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
